block.p: Mary Kathryn McKinney, the daughter of Kathryn McKinney of New Canaan, Conn., and David E. McKinney of Paris, was married yesterday at Waveny House in New Canaan to Dr. Steven Richard Meshnick, the son of Martha Meshnick of New Hyde Park, L.I., and the late Frank Meshnick. The Rev. B. Harrison Taylor, a Presbyterian minister who is an uncle of the bride, and Rabbi Burt Aaron Siegel officiated.

The bride, 33 years old, is keeping her name. She is studying for a doctorate in clinical psychology at the Graduate Center of the City University of New York. A graduate of Brown University, she received a master's degree in clinical psychology from the City University. Her father is the president and chief executive of the IBM Europe Middle East Africa Corporation in Paris.

Mary Kathryn McKinney, the daughter of Kathryn McKinney of New Canaan, Conn., and David E. McKinney of Paris, was married yesterday at Waveny House in New Canaan to Dr. Steven Richard Meshnick, the son of Martha Meshnick of New Hyde Park, L.I., and the late Frank Meshnick. The Rev. B. Harrison Taylor, a Presbyterian minister who is an uncle of the bride, and Rabbi Burt Aaron Siegel officiated.

The bride, 33 years old, is keeping her name. She is studying for a doctorate in clinical psychology at the Graduate Center of the City University of New York. A graduate of Brown University, she received a master's degree in clinical psychology from the City University. Her father is the president and chief executive of the IBM Europe Middle East Africa Corporation in Paris.

Dr. Meshnick, 39, is an associate professor of microbiology and a researcher in parasitic diseases at the City University Medical School. A graduate of Columbia University, he received an M.D. from Cornell University and a doctorate in medical biochemistry from Rockefeller University. His mother, who is retired, was a public-school secretary in New York. His father was a customer s' representative at Hirsch & Company, a New York stockbrokerage.
